title: ADDIE Model-Based Arabic Writing Material Development and Teaching Method Workshop for Autistic Children

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational special education theories and basic understanding of the Arabic script system
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education using digital devices (tablets/smartboards), emphasizing the ability to develop teaching materials applicable to real classroom environments

learning_goals: Customized Arabic writing materials for children with autism can be designed by applying the five stages of the ADDIE model (Analysis-Design-Development-Implementation-Evaluation)
Three or more types of Arabic writing activity materials utilizing graphemes and visual cues can be developed
The effectiveness of developed materials can be measured by learner engagement and writing accuracy metrics through project-based assessment
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
